page.title: 1620TH CENTURY NACKINGTON
page.content: A new Canterbury to Dover by-pass road cuts through the area and 2 new bridges have been built over it, one on the B2068 road near Winters Farm and one in Stuppington Lane. In this area nearer to Canterbury some modern buildings have been erected. A small complex of prestigious homes has been built near{Stuppington Farm.}Some of the 18th century farm buildings and barns have been converted or very tastefully and faithfully copied. The Foundation of{Simon Langton Boys'} {School}goes back to 1218. Now a Kent County Council Grammar School it has over 600 pupils and moved to its new building in Nackington Road in 1959. Entry is by examination. It is hoped that pupils will stay until the age of 18, taking A Levels for entry to University.
